edu.umass.cs.gigapaxos.paxosutil

Class MessagingTask

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.umass.cs.gigapaxos.paxosutil.MessagingTask
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    LogMessagingTask

    public class MessagingTask
extends java.lang.Object
    Author:
    V. Arun This messaging task means that each msg needs to be sent to all recipients. Note: it does *NOT* mean that each msg needs to be sent to its corresponding recipient; in fact, the sizes of the two arrays, recipients and msgs, may be different. This utility class is really just a container for two arrays.

      • MessagingTask

        public MessagingTask(int[] destIDs,
                     PaxosPacket[] pkts)
        Multicast multiple packets. This is a special type of constructor compared to the others above. This is the only constructor that allows MessagingTask to be instantiated with no messages. We need this as it is convenient to create an empty MessagingTask in a logging-only LogMessagingTask object.
        Parameters:
        destIDs -
        pkts -

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Returns:
        True if isEmptyMessaging() returns true. This method exists so that it can be overridden unlike isEmptyMessaging().

      • isEmptyMessaging

        public final boolean isEmptyMessaging()
        Returns:
        Whether the list of recipients or messages is null or empty, i.e., there is nothing to do.

        FIXME: The comment below is incorrect and this method is unnecessary. Converts an object array to a PaxosPacket array because there is annoyingly no easy way in Java to convert a collection of a child type to an array of a parent type.

        Returns:
        The PaxosPacket array from the Object[].
